content.question: A hoop is released from rest at the top left of a curved track, as shown. The left half of the track is rough, and the hoop rolls without slipping. The right half of the track is smooth, and there is negligible friction between the hoop and the track. When the hoop passes through Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, the magnitude of the hoop’s angular acceleration is <math alttext="alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>. The hoop then passes through Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, located at the same height as Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, and the magnitude of the hoop’s angular acceleration is <math alttext="alpha sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="alpha sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="alpha sub A equals alpha sub B, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
